intro: Prunus campanulata f. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered cherry, is a cultivar of the Prunus genus that exhibits distinctive botanical features. It is characterized by its pale pink to white flowers, which are more prominent and showier than those of the typical species. The plant is a deciduous shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of 3 to 6 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth margin and a glossy green upper surface. The fruit is a small, dark red drupe that ripens in late summer, adding ornamental value to the plant.
